newsitem.title: GERMANY: German sentenced to jail on "sex tourist" crimes.
newsitem.headline: German sentenced to jail on "sex tourist" crimes.

text.p: A German man was sentenced on Monday to two years in prison for sexual offences against young girls during a holiday in Thailand.

A Frankfurt judge said in sentencing the 52-year-old man that the prison term was increased because the man was involved in distributing child pornography and had returned to Thailand despite the German criminal investigation.

German customs in February 1994 had confiscated a pornographic tape from the man which was turned over to Frankfurt prosecutors. He was accused, among other things, of having sex with a 10-year-old girl and having the act filmed.
The man said in court he has been attracted for some time to young Asian women but not to children.
The case was only one of a handful in which German authorities have managed to track down suspects under a law which lets them pursue Germans who commit sex offences abroad.
The 1993 law allows Germany to impose prison sentences of up to 10 years to its citizens convicted of having sex with minors abroad.
But prosecutions have been rare since evidence is hard to gather and German officials have said foreign officials often turn a blind eye to the problem.
An estimated 200,000 German men travel abroad each year in search of sex, many seeking girls under 14, according to German child welfare experts.

In a similar sex tourism case, Berlin prosecutors in late August filed charges against two German men for sexually abusing children in Thailand and distributing pornographic films and pictures of their acts.
The two men, aged 43 and 33, are alleged to have carried out indecent acts with children as young as 10 years old between 1994 and 1995.
Like the Frankfurt case, Berlin prosecutors were alerted to the two men by customs officials who intercepted packages containing pornographic photographs and order forms.
Another German man accused of committing sex offences with young children in Asia also goes on trial later this month in the Philippines.
Engineer, Konrad Heinrich Jecht, 63, of Munich, faces three counts of child abuse for his alleged fondling of the private parts of two boys aged 16 and 15.

Jecht, who pleaded not guilty last week to the charges in a Manila courtroom, is one of the latest to be prosecuted as part of a crackdown in the Philippines to eradicate the country's image as a haven for paedophiles.
Philippine courts recently sentenced a Briton and an Australian to up to 17 years each for sexually molesting children.
